Package hw4

Class AttachedElement

java.lang.Object
api.AbstractElement
hw4.SimpleElement
hw4.MovingElement
hw4.AssociatedElement
hw4.AttachedElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable
public class AttachedElement extends AssociatedElement
An attached element is one that is associated with another "base" element such as a PlatformElement or a LiftElement. Specifically, the attached element's movement is determined by the movement of the base element, the element always remains a fixed distance away. This class extends the abstract class AssociatedElement.
Author:
Nicholas Jacobs

  • Constructor Details

    • AttachedElement

      public AttachedElement(int width, int height, int offset, int hover)
      Constructs a new AttachedElement. Before being added to an associated "base" element such as a PlatformElement or LiftElement, the x and y coordinates are initialized to zero. When the base object is set (not in this constructor), the x-coordinate will be calculated as the base object's x-coordinate, plus the given offset, and the y-coordinate will become the base object's y-coordinate, minus this element's height, minus the hover amount.
      Parameters:
      width - element's width
      height - element's height
      offset - when added to a base object, this amount will be added to the other object's x-coordinate to calculate this element's x-coordinate
      hover - when added to a base object, this element's y-coordinate is the other object's y-coordinate, minus this element's height, minus the hover amount

  • Method Details

    • calculatePosition

      protected void calculatePosition()
      Gets the current position of the base object and updates this objects position relative to it. x = base x + offset y = base y - this.height - hover
      Overrides:
      calculatePosition in class AssociatedElement
      See Also:
      • SimpleElement.setPosition(double, double)

    • move

      protected void move()
      Description copied from class: MovingElement
      Protected helper method for moving this object. To be called in update and can be overridden by subclasses.
